articles.author: Karen Freifeld, Alexandra Alper
articles.description: The Biden administration warned Beijing of its plans to update rules that curb shipments of AI chips and chipmaking tools to China as soon as early October, a U.S. official said, a policy decision aimed at stabilizing relations between the superpowers.
articles.title: Exclusive: US warned China to expect updated export curbs in October-US official

articles.author: Paritosh Bansal
articles.description: The U.S. bond market is calling a moment: the age of low interest rates and inflation that began with the 2008 financial crisis has ended. What follows is unclear.
articles.title: In the Market: US bond market signals the end of an era

articles.author: Luc Cohen
articles.description: Sam Bankman-Fried will likely defend himself at his fraud trial, due to begin on Tuesday, by arguing he did not think the use by his FTX cryptocurrency exchange of customer funds was improper and by challenging the credibility of those who say otherwise.
articles.title: Sam Bankman-Fried's fraud trial: How will he defend himself?

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Jeff Zucker-led RedBird IMI has invested in Front Office Sports (FOS) and the former CNN president will join its board as co-chair, the media company focused on sports business said on Monday.
articles.title: Former CNN Chief Jeff Zucker buys stake in Front Office Sports

articles.author: David Shepardson
articles.description: General Motors (GM.N) said Monday it was indefinitely laying off about 160 workers at plants in Indiana and Ohio because of the impact of the United Auto Workers strike on some facilities.
articles.title: GM furloughs another 160 workers due to UAW strike

articles.author: Shubham Batra, Shashwat Chauhan
articles.description: The Nasdaq rose on Monday, boosted by gains in growth stocks as investors awaited commentary from more Federal Reserve officials and economic data this week to gauge the central bank's interest-rate path.
articles.title: Nasdaq rises on boost from growth stocks; Fed comments in focus

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Birkenstock, the German premium footwear brand backed by private-equity firm L Catterton, said on Monday it is seeking a valuation of up to $9.2 billion in its highly anticipated initial public offering (IPO) in New York.
articles.title: Germany's Birkenstock targets $9.2 bln valuation in New York IPO

articles.author: Jack Queen
articles.description: Donald Trump and his family business are set to stand trial in New York on Monday in a civil fraud case that could deal a major blow to the former U.S. president’s real estate empire.
articles.title: Donald Trump's business empire in peril as civil fraud trial opens in New York

articles.author: Olena Harmash
articles.description: EU foreign ministers held their first ever meeting outside the bloc in Ukraine on Monday, a show of support for the country after a pro-Russian candidate won an election in Slovakia and the U.S. Congress omitted funding for Kyiv from a spending bill.
articles.title: EU ministers convene in Ukraine to show support after US, Slovakia wobbles

articles.author: John Kruzel
articles.description: The U.S. Supreme Court began its new term on Monday with arguments in a criminal sentencing case, setting out on a nine-month legal journey that will test how far its 6-3 conservative majority is willing to steer American law in a rightward direction.
articles.title: Curtain comes up on new term for conservative US Supreme Court
